intro: Pastinaca tolucensis, commonly known as the Tolucan scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Pastinaca tolucensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
